html:
** Payment network Mastercard MA.N dropping 4.9% to $323.07 on Mon after touching lowest level since Feb and putting it among the S&P 500's .SPX weakest performers

** Mobile payments firm Square SQ.N fell 7.4% and online payment service PayPal Holdings PYPL.O dropped 3.3%

** MA had touched a low of $319.76 with trading volume 1.2 times 10-DMA. Visa V.N, outperforming its peers on Mon, was still down 1.7% on the day. It had tumbled 5% last week on news from Amazon.com AMZN.O

** SQ last traded at $208.38 after hitting low of $205.28, its lowest level since late May

** Jefferies analyst Trevor Williams pointed to a risk off investing mode on Mon hurting high-growth stocks as Treasury yields rise

** "Coupled with that for MasterCard is headlines around the spikes in cases in Europe. In particular, I think there's some negative read across for what that can mean for international travel in the near term," Williams said.

** While Visa has so far been the most directly affected by Amazon's announcement last week it would stop accepting U.K. Visa credit cards in Jan, Williams argued it was not good news for any of the payment companies

** Reuters wrote that the Amazon/Visa spat shows big retailers, armed with a growing array of payment options, are gaining the upper hand in their power struggle with card providers (Full Story)

** Elsewhere in payments, Bill.com Holdings Inc BILL.N was off 6.3%. American Express AXP.N was just off 1.1%


(Reporting By Sinéad Carew)

(( sinead.carew@thomsonreuters.com ; +1 (646) 223 6186; Reuters Messaging: sinead.carew.thomsonreuters.com@reuters.net ))
